text.more:
You can use the search bar to search for a specific game. For the best experience, it is recommended to view this page on a computer. When you click on a game's node, you'll automatically visualize a subset of the network (the game's 'ego-network') with some game-specific information.

Games: All games that received at least 1 vote appear here.

Modularity class: This defines groups of games clustered together using the Modularity Optimization Algorithm for community detection. The games with a given color tend to be more densly connected to other games of that color.

score_f: This is the total score reached by the game in this year's voting. The size of each node is scaled using this value.

Eigenvector Centrality: A Measure telling you how well-connected a node is. The closer it is to 1, the more frequently a game appears on lists containing other well-connected games. You can see this as an indicator of the game's popularity where 1 is the maximum and 0 the minimum.

Connections: This is a list of games that appeard on a user's list at least twice together with the game that you're currently looking at. Please, note that this year there were only 120 voters so this is more of a proof of concept.
